sen.j: 辞（じ）とは、律令制において雑任以下の下級官人及び一般庶民（白丁）が、官司に上申する際に用いたとされる文書。
sen.e: Zi is monjo (written material) used by lower-ranking government officials equal to or below the rank of Zonin or by the common people or hakucho (inferior servants) when they reported to their superiors, under the ritsuryo system (a system of centralized government based on the ritsuryo code).

sen.j: だが、この規定が難解で分かりにくかったためか、現存の辞は残されておらず、辞が適切と思われる内容に関する公文書でも解 (公文書)などの他の形式が用いられているのがほとんどである。
sen.e: However, probably because this prescription was difficult to understand, zi does not remain today, and as an official document which ought to have been made as zi, other forms such as ge (a form of an official document) were used.
